comment: A gentle soft sweetness is the first sensation on the palate, like so much good Japanese whisky, the subtlety is what makes it intriguing. There is a lot of solid spice, cedar on the palate, with a soft aftertaste that reminds me of agave syrup, without being cloying. Definitely a special whisky for after dinner.

definitely a stands out when tasted side to side with the traditional Mars. there is a slight mineral note towards the end, my guess is this is where the "ash" name comes from. excellent sample of a good Japanese whisky for $120
Very good and smooth stuff with flavors of sandalwood, lemon zest, pomegranate, almonds, and berries
